intro: Conopharyngia stapfiana, commonly known as the Stapf's conopharyngia, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Conopharyngiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant typically found in specific high-altitude habitats in tropical regions. The plant features simple, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish in color. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, a common trait in its native environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
